intro: Phalacraea coelestina, commonly known as the sky-blue star-of-Bethlehem, is a striking member of the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, sky-blue flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is considered rare in the wild.
